result.execSummary:
The defendant Shawn J Lemieux II was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Manuf/Deliver Schedule I, II Narcotics [Modifiers: Possession with Intent to Deliver/Distribute a Controlled Substance On or Near a School], a class E felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(1)(a).
  • Bail Jumping-Misdemeanor, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(a).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

chargeModifiers.descr: Possession with Intent to Deliver/Distribute a Controlled Substance On or Near a School

miscConds.notes: $100 fine plus costs on each count.   If probation is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt. To pay supervision fees as ordered by the Dept. of Corrections.
Maintain full-time employment and/or schooling. Obtain high school diploma or GED/HSED.

Maintain absolute sobriety from alcohol.   Not to possess or consume any controlled substances without a valid prescription and then only in the amount and frequency prescribed.   Not to possess or use any drug paraphernalia. No contact with victims or co-defendants.
Complete any counseling, evaluations, programs and assessments, including AODA assessment, as appropriate resulting from the Department's COMPAS assessment.

timeConds.notes: Jail time applies to Ct. 5. 60 days stayed, to be used at the Court's discretion by petition from probation agent. Huber release granted. 60 days to report. Credit for time served if probation is revoked.
To perform 60 hours of uncompensated community service with a not-for-profit agency. Concurrent to 13-CM-274.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

supervisions.notes:
Credit for time served.
Consecutive to: 14-CF-115

superMiscConds.notes: Complete any counseling, evaluations, programs and assessments, including AODA assessment, as appropriate resulting from the Department's COMPAS assessment.
Maintain full-time employment and/or schooling. Obtain GED/HSED.

Maintain absolute sobriety from alcohol.  Not to possess or consume any controlled substances without a valid prescription and then only take in the amount and frequency prescribed. No contact with anyone involved with illegal drug possession, use or sales.   Not to possess or use any drug paraphernalia.

$100 fine plus costs. Cash bond applied.  If probation is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.

records.addlTxt: Defendant Shawn J Lemieux in court with attorney Charles D Wingrove.  Joan M Korb appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Minute sheet. State gives plea agreement.  Court questions defendant on change of plea.  Rights/elements/max. penalties reviewed with defendant.  Defendant enters no contest plea to Cts. 3 & 5. Defense stipulates to factual basis to accept plea.  Court finds pleas made freely, knowingly and voluntarily, accepts pleas, and finds guilty of Cts. 3 & 5. Court dismisses Cts. 1, 2 & 4 but reads in for sentencing. Court reviews collateral consequences, possible penalties for felony conviction with defendant. Defendant must submit a DNA sample to the State of Wisconsin and pay the $250 DNA surcharge. State/Defense ready to proceed to sentencing without the benefit of a PSI. Bond is no longer in effect.
Defense waives reading of Information and enters not guilty plea.  Bond remains as is.
State's Discovery Demand

Defendant Shawn J Lemieux in court with attorney Charles D. Wingrove.  Joan M. Korb appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defense waives right to Prelim. Court questions defendant on waiver. Court finds waiver made freely and voluntarily, accepts waiver and binds over for trial. Court finds probable cause for bindover.  Status conference scheduled for May 22, 2014 at 08:15 am.
Defense Discovery Demand
Preliminary hearing on March 11, 2014 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Shawn J Lemieux in court with attorney Charles D. Wingrove.  Joan M. Korb appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Copy of Complaint given to Defendant in Court.  Court reviews charge(s), max. penalties, right to counsel, right to preliminary hearing. Defense waives reading of the complaint, waives time limit for prelim. Atty Wingrove indicates defendant may be exercising his right for substitution of judge, will file paperwork if he wishes to do so. Bond remains as is.
Defendant was fingerprinted 2/11/14 by jail staff. (fingerprint card destroyed 6/20/14)
Initial appearance on February 24, 2014 at 11:15 am.
from defendant asking to move hearing up as he can't post bond. Court keeps IA on for 2/24/14.

by Debbie Berger
Per JA Sheryl Ripp, Atty Charles Wingrove will be representing defendant. Atty Wingrove not available for hearing at 3:15 on 2/24/14. Court moves hearing to 11:15 AM on 2/24/14.

Not to possess or consume any controlled substances without a valid prescription and then only in the amount and frequency prescribed.  Not to possess or use any drug paraphernalia.  To be fingerprinted and photographed before leaving the Justice Center.

Defendant Shawn J Lemieux appears by video conference along with attorney Carrie LaPlant, who appears by phone.  Joan M. Korb appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Atty LaPlant indicates she's only representing defendant for bond hearing, different counsel will be appointed. State gives incident report, potential charges.  Court questions Defendant on address/employment history, reviews right to Counsel.  Court finds probable cause, sets bond.  Initial appearance scheduled for February 24, 2014 at 11:15 am.
